title: Is there a way to penetrate and divert a lava flow? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. The WESTMAN Islandlanders , of Iceland, diverted a volcano lava flow, which nearly closd down their sea port harbor. Which was, the only safe haven for their fishing fleet. Their only industry. The lava was also burning down, and covering their town. The Islanders used every ship board fire supressing system, which each fishing boat had, to pump sea water on the fluid, fresh lava flows;, threatening their livelihood, homes, and village. With almost endless streams of Icy North Atlantic water, they were able to cool some of the lava streams, into sturdy, solid dikes. They continued to create, solid lava baffles,, for many days. A herculean effort. Till.the eruption was over, and they had preserved their means of making a living, and very homes. There are various movies on the web, showing the Westman Island heros, doing the impossible. Channeling away lava flows. It was a deadly, heroic effort. But they won.
Diversions have been tried, but have met with little success. Lava is pretty aggressive stuff. One of the best known attempts: Eldfell - Wikipedia
